channel.title: How do I add Dragon Claws to my server?
channel.description: I am using the Models by Galkon on Rune - Server. I know to add them to the Models in the client, but then, after that, how do I add the claws?

item.title: How do I add Dragon Claws to my server?
item.dc:creator: @Word_Life Word Life
item.description:
@Word_Life wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:9, topic:281074”]the ::add model stuff doesnt do crap.

go to your class8.java in your client.
Add your ints.
Get your d claw models add em in models section (in client still)
Go to you client.java (in actual server files)
Now search 667 hit enter as many times until your at the last thing that says 667.
It should be in the 2h section.
add 8002 (commonly used d claws id or w.e u have as id)
Go to item.cfg
add your stats.
Go to weapons.java (or wearing.java forgot which)
go to the dragon section add your id.
your done.[/quote]

I’m not THAT good of a coder, so for stuff like the item.cfg thing where I add my stats, I don’t really know what I’m supposed to put in there.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I add Dragon Claws to my server?

item.title: How do I add Dragon Claws to my server?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

the ::add model stuff doesnt do crap.

go to your class8.java in your client.
Add your ints.
Get your d claw models add em in models section (in client still)
Go to you client.java (in actual server files)
Now search 667 hit enter as many times until your at the last thing that says 667.
It should be in the 2h section.
add 8002 (commonly used d claws id or w.e u have as id)
Go to item.cfg
add your stats.
Go to weapons.java (or wearing.java forgot which)
go to the dragon section add your id.
your done.

item.title: How do I add Dragon Claws to my server?
item.dc:creator: @Word_Life Word Life
item.description:
@Word_Life wrote:

Nevermind. Found where it goes.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 29, 2009, 07:48:32 pm[/size][hr]Okay, I don’t know why, but it turned out as Some Skeleton hands, and when I equip it, you don’t see it wielded. I try to use special, and regular attack, it looks like I’m just attacking with my fists. What’s going on?

Read full topic
item.source: How do I add Dragon Claws to my server?

item.title: How do I add Dragon Claws to my server?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Ill just do everythign for you, sorta.

You say you have galkons models… so add them into your client files(keep in .rar form) and in a folder called Models

Than add this into your class8.java

if(i == 8002) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield"; class8.anInt174 = 13698; class8.anInt181 = 738; // zoom; increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 245; // model rotate; up+down increase to move down away from you class8.anInt198 = 80; // model rotate; side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = -2; // model offset; increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 3; // model offset; increase to move up class8.anInt165 = 13699; class8.anInt200 = 13699; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.aString170 = "Dragon claws"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A pair of claws, once enchanted by the gods.".getBytes(); }

than look in client.java of client side and look for your addmodel method

depending on client it should mroe or less look like this

} else { String s = aString887.toLowerCase(); if(s.startsWith("add model")) { try { int ModelIndex = Integer.parseInt(s.substring(10)); byte[] abyte0 = GetModel(ModelIndex); if(abyte0 != null && abyte0.length > 0){ aClass14Array970[1].method234(abyte0.length, abyte0, (byte)2, ModelIndex); method77("Model: ["+ModelIndex+"] added successfully!", 0, "", aBoolean991); }else{ method77("Unable to find the model. "+ModelIndex, 0, "", aBoolean991); } } catch(Exception e) { method77("Syntax - ::add model <path>", 0, "", aBoolean991);} }

than long on ingame and do that command, ::add model 8002(or w/e model number is in .rar)

Than you can spawn item 8002 and theres your d claws

Read full topic
